entry.title: DIAMOND COMPLEX NOW 90 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: September 25, 2024 11:00 a.m. The Diamond Complex, burning on the Umpqua National Forest is 90 percent contained, as midday Wednesday. A UNF update said California Interagency Incident Management Team 14 will transfer command of the complex to Northwest Complex Incident Management Team 12, at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday. entry.title: HOMESTEAD COMPLEX GROWS BY 57 ACRES
entry.summary: September 25, 2024 10:40 a.m. The Homestead Complex, burning in the Umpqua National Forest, grew by 57 acres in the 24-hours ending midday Wednesday. A UNF update said the complex is now listed at 35,803 acres. On the Horse Heaven Fire, infrared detected hot spots in the northwest portion of the fire. Firefighters extinguished and...

entry.title: UNF REDUCES CLOSURE AREAS

entry.title: FIRE SEASON STILL ACTIVE IN DOUGLAS DISTRICT
entry.summary: September 25, 2024 9:40 a.m. Fire season is still active throughout the Douglas District. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope lands they protect are currently at a Moderate fire danger level, Moderate Public Use Restrictions with an IFPL at Level 2. Pope said for the public, Moderate Public Use Restrictions means non-industrial power saw usage,...

entry.title: CHI Mercy Medical Center nurses continue months long contract negotiations
entry.summary: Oregon’s Hospital Staffing Law went into effect Sept. 1, 2023, calling on hospitals to implement minimum nurse-to-patient ratios. CHI Mercy Health nurses claim the hospital has not complied to the new law forcing nurses into contract negotiations.

entry.title: Tree School Umpqua makes return this weekend
entry.summary: The Oregon State University Extension Service in Douglas County is bringing back Tree School Umpqua this Saturday after a five-year hiatus.

entry.title: The tree of hope committee: The name says it all

entry.summary: The Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians were the final stop on Gov. Tina Kotek's commitment to visit the nine federally recognized Tribal nations in Oregon this year.

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAS RECORD BREAKING HEAT FOR TUESDAY
entry.summary: September 25, 2024 3:50 a.m. Roseburg had record breaking heat for the date on Tuesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 99 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record for September 24th was 95 degrees, set in 1997. Forecasters said the...

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY EMPLOYERS ADD 70 JOBS IN AUGUST

entry.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI INTRODUCES NEW SOUTHERN WHITE RHINO

entry.title: Sixth Grade Forestry Days media opportunity Sept. 26
entry.summary: Sixth graders from Clatsop County get hands-on experience in possible forestry careers. More than 400 students from area schools will rotate through nine different stations. What: Watch students from Warrenton, Seaside and Anchor Christian Academy participate and rotate through nine different stations: tree planting, wildland fire fighting, wood products, fisheries, recreation, tree ID, wildlife rescue, mushrooms and tree measurements. Visuals: See students receive hands-on training on how to plant trees, use a fire hose to hit a target, learn about on-site local fish, take a hike and ID plants and much more. People on-site available to interview: Students and teachers, experts from the Oregon Department of Forestry, Oregon State Extension Service, Oregon Parks and Recreation, Clatsop Cou…

entry.title: DEVIL’S KNOB FIRE NOW 86 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: September 22, 2024 2:00 p.m. The Devil’s Knob Fire is 86 percent contained as of midday Sunday. Crews are completing mop up operations and will continue patrolling, monitoring, and conducting suppression repair where needed. The...
